title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM

description.narrative: By 2022, the Government has increased its capacity to reactivate the specialized system for the comprehensive protection of children and adolescents, with a gender and intercultural perspective and the capacity to respond to emergencies., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents in Ecuador exercise their right to a life free from violence and exploitation, with a focus on early childhood and adolescence, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Government has increased its capacity to reactivate the specialized system for the comprehensive protection ofchildren and adolescents, with a gender and intercultural perspective and the capacity to respond to emergencies.

description.narrative: UNICEF Ecuador continued to strengthen the protection system for children and adolescent rights at central level and local/community level, using violence prevention and care models. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of communities that count with mechanisms to prevent violence against children and adolescent at the community level.(67204)

target.value: 2022:Systematization of the implementation of childhood and adolescence protection model at community level

actual.value: 2021:6 communities implement mechanisms to prevent violence against children, with emphasis on GBV.

title.narrative: Number of children, parents and primary caregivers provided with community based mental health and psychosocial support and messaging [COVIDSitRep]
Number of children, parents and primary caregivers provided with community based mental health and psychosocial support and messaging [COVIDSitRep]
Number of children, parents and primary caregivers provided with community based mental health and psychosocial support and messaging [COVIDSitRep]
Number of children, parents and primary caregivers provided with community based mental health and psychosocial support and messaging [COVIDSitRep]

Actors from the judicial sector count with a unified protocol to recognize, refer and attend cases of violence againgst children; and a forensic protocol of specialized listening for victims of sexual violence (67203)

baseline.value: An assessment of the attention of cases of violence against children in the judicial system.

target.value: 2022:Systematization of the implementation of the unified protocol to recognize, refer and attend cases of violence against children and adolescents; and of the forensic protocol of specialized listening for victims of sexual violence

actual.value: 2021:The forensic protocol of specialized listening is implemented. The unified protocol to refer and attend cases of violence approval is still pending due to Institutional changes.

title.narrative: The legislative, executive (prioritzed institutions) and judicial systems are aware of the importance of a specialized and specific child protection system.(67202)

baseline.value: Public institutions are not aware on the needs.

target.value: 2022:3 municipalities implement the new model of a decentralized protection system

actual.value: 2021:The municipalities of Tulcan and Manta implemented a model to improve their local protection systems.
